# splinemixmeta

Non-parametric meta-regression using splines from mgcv with
mixed-effects meta-analysis from mixmeta

Install the package from GitHub:

``` r
# Install the remotes package if you haven't already
install.packages("remotes")

# Install the package from GitHub
remotes::install_github("perrydv/splinemixmeta")
```

## Issues and help

Please report any issues (bugs or errors) on the [issues
link](https://github.com/perrydv/splinemixmeta/issues) for the
repository.

## Contributing

Please view our
[contributing](https://github.com/fawda123/splinemixmeta/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md)
guidelines for any changes or pull requests.

## Code of Conduct

Please note that the splinemixmeta project is released with a
[Contributor Code of
Conduct](https://fawda123.github.io/splinemixmeta/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.html).
By contributing to this project, you agree to abide by its terms.

# Package index

## All functions

- [`blup.splinemixmeta()`](https://fawda123.github.io/splinemixmeta/reference/blup.splinemixmeta.md)
  :

  Obtain predictions (BLUPs) from a `splinemixmeta` object

- [`make_smm_smooth()`](https://fawda123.github.io/splinemixmeta/reference/make_smm_smooth.md)
  :

  Create random effects and fixed effects specifications from an mgcv
  smooth term for use in `splinemixmeta`.

- [`plot(`*`<splinemixmeta>`*`)`](https://fawda123.github.io/splinemixmeta/reference/plot.splinemixmeta.md)
  :

  Plot results from a univariate `splinemixmeta` model

- [`predict(`*`<splinemixmeta>`*`)`](https://fawda123.github.io/splinemixmeta/reference/predict.splinemixmeta.md)
  :

  Make predictions from a fitted `splinemixmeta` model

- [`splinemixmeta()`](https://fawda123.github.io/splinemixmeta/reference/splinemixmeta.md)
  : Fit a mixed-effects meta-analysis model with inclusion of one or
  more spline terms
